question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Coca-Cola recalls products due to metal contamination by August 2024, will Danone also recall products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Coca-Cola recalls any of its products due to metal contamination by August 31, 2024. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products.

Then, will Danone announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination by August 31, 2024? The recall must be officially confirmed by Danone or a relevant food safety authority and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both Coca-Cola and Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone announce recalls of any of their products due to metal contamination. Each recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If either company does not announce such a recall within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Indiana conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana, primarily focused on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth? The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana, primarily focused on abortion rights protection, and publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) Colorado enacts a new law by July 31, 2024, that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado.

If either (a) or (b) does not occur by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state, meeting all the specified criteria.

Then, will Tennessee enact new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, as confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Union Pacific implementing a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024, will they reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?

The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024, will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body:

The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. Then, is it true that the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, will exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES, the specified condition must be met within the timeframe. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for resolution.

(2) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on a major cybersecurity company fully relocating its headquarters to Austin by July 2024, will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body:

The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership and reported by at least two major, reputable news sources. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred. Partial relocations or plans still in progress by the deadline will not be sufficient.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Google will face additional legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity? These legal actions may include lawsuits or regulatory actions and must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets. They must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major cybersecurity company fully relocates its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024, and (b) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body:

(a) By July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this to resolve as YES:
   1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
   2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
   3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.
   Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be met for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?

If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Mexico's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on California holding a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, will Tennessee hold a referendum on healthcare access by July 2024?

question.title: Will Stanford University fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from lower-income families by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Stanford University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Stanford University fully covering tuition for lower-income undergraduates by July 2024, will South Carolina implement a free community college plan by the same date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Stanford University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. This must be confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO. If the condition about the Mexican economy is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Mexican economy avoids a recession and (b) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Mexican economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both conditions are not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

The question will resolve as NO if either state does not conduct such a referendum meeting these criteria by August 31, 2024. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Nigeria maintains its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August 2024, will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

question.title: Given Mercedes-Benz receives over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives, will the U.S. government initiate a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives, based on official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations. The grants must be specifically for electric vehicle-related projects. Then, will the U.S. government initiate a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project by July 31, 2024? For the U.S. government to be considered to have initiated a new legal challenge, the following criteria must be met:

1. The legal challenge must be officially filed in a U.S. court.
2. The challenge must be specifically against a renewable energy project.
3. The legal action must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

The question resolves as YES if such a legal challenge meeting all the above criteria is initiated by the U.S. government by July 31, 2024, and NO if it is not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz receives over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives, and (b) the U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a renewable energy project. The legal challenge must be officially filed in a U.S. court, specifically against a renewable energy project, and reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets. The question will resolve as NO if no such legal challenge meeting all the above criteria is initiated by the U.S. government by July 31, 2024. Note that this does not consider any past or current legal challenges, only new ones initiated after October 1, 2023.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

Then, will the following be true? By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:

3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

question.title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. The referendum topic must directly address cannabis regulation, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?

question.title: Given Missouri conducts a referendum on healthcare access by August 2024, will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
